DOC.brief_summary: This study seek develop , implement , assess innovative 15-session couple-based intervention deliver group format young parent aim strengthen relationship reduce HIV risk . The ultimate goal intervention reduce HIV/STD risk ( concurrency , number partner , unprotected sex ) , strengthen relationship , improve parenting among young parent heterosexual couple .
DOC.brief_title: A Couple-Based Relationship Strengthening HIV Intervention Young Parents
DOC.detailed_description: This study develop couple-based HIV prevention intervention innovative important integrates intervention improve sexual health , relationship functioning , parent skill . Our intervention integrate exist community base parent program . By target high risk heterosexual couple experience important life transition increase stress , conflict , sexual risk , investigator provide maximum benefit men , woman , child community . Using guide framework Attachment Theory principle Emotion Focused Therapy , investigator directly address issue emotion , intimacy , relationship function create intervention strengthen romantic relationship reduces HIV risk behavior . The investigator conduct small pilot randomize control trial 50 parenting couple randomize either relationship strengthen HIV prevention intervention active control . The intervention last 15 week session approximately 1.5 hour long . The investigator assess couple baseline , 4-months , 8-months .
DOC.criteria: Women 's age 14 25 Men 's age 14 old Have child 01 year old In romantic relationship mother/father baby Not know HIV positive English speaking Child old 1 year HIV positive
